intro: Pilosella subulatissima, commonly known as the slender pearly everlet, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy, needle-like leaves that are often covered in fine white pubescence. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Pilosella subulatissima is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
